subject: Re: code coverage tool Java
msgSnippet: We have an Eclipse plug-in that calculates path and branch coverage, measures code testability, and designs JUnit tests. The plug-in is free for the open
messageBody:
We have an Eclipse plug-in that calculates path and branch coverage,
measures code testability, and designs JUnit tests.

The plug-in is free for the open source community and students, and
costs $99 for everyone else.

You can download it at www.codign.com.

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Joe Brutto" <revof11@...> wrote:
>
> Try out Cobertura at http://cobertura.sourceforge.net/
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, André Severo Meira <andre1704d@> wrote:
> >
> > Muito obrigado!
> > Abraços!
> > OK
> >
> >
> > Bob Evans <bobevans@> escreveu:
> > At Agitar, we have a freely downloadable tool that
> provides basis-
> > path coverage from running tests. It is the junitfactory.com plugin
> > for Eclipse.
> > You don't have to use it to generate tests (it's primary purpose),
> > you can just use it to run your junit tests, in which case it will
> > show you a summary view and a detailed view in the margins of a
> > source buffer.
> >
> > Hope that helps,
> >
> > Bob
> >
> > http://www.junitfactory.com/
> > See testing in action, on your own code.
> >
> > On Aug 20, 2007, at 5:21 AM, avinash anand wrote:
> >
> > > Can anyone suggest a good code coverage tool for Java code. Does
> > > JUnit has testing code coverage capability.
> > > I have evaluated Agitar but its very costly $50000 for 10 licenses,
> > > please suggest some opensource or cheaper version of them
> > >
